Generation IV.Diamond: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.
Generation IV.Pearl: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.
Generation IV.Platinum: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.
Generation IV.HeartGold: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.

Generation VI.X: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
Generation VI.Y: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

Generation VIII.Sword: It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into the snow to absorb water and keep its own temperature down.
Generation VIII.Shield: The berries that grow around its belly are like ice pops. Galarian Darumaka absolutely love these berries.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: One is likely to encounter this Pokémon while out in the snow. There are stories of Snover appearing in human settlements but doing no harm—rather, they bond with the children.

Generation IX.Scarlet: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain’s lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
Generation IX.Violet: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.
